text: Hroth (*hrōþ) is a Proto-Germanic term for fame, glory, appearing in various personal names: *Robert *Hrōþ-berht "fame-bright" *Rudolph *Hrōþ-wulf- "fame- wolf" *Roderick *Hrōþi-rīk- "famous ruler" *Hrothgar or Roger *Hrōþi-gaiz- "famous spear" *Roland "fame-land" The putative goddess Hretha mentioned by Bede would likely also be connected to the same etymon. Category:Given names
title: Hrōþ
